sub_topic: Identifying the Eulerian and Hamiltonian paths in a graph.
message_1:
Consider the following graph:

        A----B
        |    |
        C----D

Does this graph contain an Eulerian circuit? If yes, provide the circuit. If no, explain why not.
message_2:
This graph does contain an Eulerian circuit. An Eulerian circuit is a closed path that traverses each edge of a graph exactly once. A graph has an Eulerian circuit if and only if all its vertices have an even degree (number of edges incident to the vertex).

In this graph, all vertices have a degree of 2, which is even. Therefore, an Eulerian circuit exists. One possible Eulerian circuit is: A-B-D-C-A.
